meanings.definition: A cell or group of cells that receives stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The receptor on the skin senses touch.
meanings.sent2: The receptor in the eye detects light.
meanings.sent3: The receptor in the nose found the delicious smell of cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a receptor for his love, always open and welcoming.
meanings.sent5: The receptor in the ear eagerly listened to the music.

meanings.definition: A protein molecule on the surface of a cell that binds to specific substances.
meanings.sent1: The receptor on the cell membrane interacts with hormones.
meanings.sent2: The virus attaches to the receptor on the host cell.
meanings.sent3: The receptor on the cell was like a gatekeeper, allowing only certain molecules to enter.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a receptor for knowledge, always seeking to learn more.
meanings.sent5: The receptor on the taste bud detected the sweet flavor of the fruit.
